classes.cCustomNote: Choose one of the following: MATH141, or MATH161. Students emphasizing Chemistry, Physics, or Engineering should take MATH141 and MATH142.

Choose one of the following: PHYS121, or PHYS141. Students emphasizing Physics should take PHYS141, PHYS142, and PHYS133.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.
